text.*:
A Maritime power is a nation with a very strong navy, which often is also a great power, or at least a regional power. A Maritime power is able to easily control their coast, and exert influence upon both nearby and far countries. A nation that dominates the world navally is known as a maritime superpower.

    • 1.1 Emerging
    • 1.2 Possible
    • 1.3 Actual

Maritime power[edit]

Emerging[edit]

Many countries that become maritime powers, become strong in order to defend themselves from an extant threat, such as the USSR did during the Cold War, in order to defend themselves from the United States Navy. In this scenario, it is common for the emerging maritime power to focus largely upon area denial tactics, rather than power projection.[1]

Possible[edit]

Actual[edit]

Maritime powers are often much more involved in global politics and trade.[2]

History[edit]

This section is empty. You can help by adding to it. (February 2018)

Historic Maritime powers[edit]

  • Republic of Venice dominated trade on the Mediterranean Sea, including commerce between Europe and North Africa, as well as Asia.
  • The British Empire was at one point both a Superpower, or, as some political historians say, a Hyperpower, alongside being a Maritime power.[citation needed]
  • Soviet Union. Although the USSR traditionally had a strong focus on land, a period of rapid naval expansion allowed them to dominate their area.[3]

Current Maritime powers[edit]

  • China.[G20][BRICS][3] China is considered a great power by many scholars, and is considered by some scholars to be a potential superpower.[4][5]
  • France.[G7][G20][6] France is also a great power.[7]
  • India.[G20][BRICS][8][9][10][11] India is a great power with blue-water capabilities.
  • Japan.[G7][G20][12] Japan is also a great power.[13][14][15]
  • Russia.[G20][BRICS][16] Russia is also a great power, and has been characterized as a potential superpower.[17][18]
  • United Kingdom.[G7][G20][A][B] Royal Navy is considered a Blue water navy[19]
  • United States of America.[G7][G20][3] According to almost all scholars, America is the lone superpower of the 21st century, and according to some it is a hyperpower.[20][21][22][23][24][25]

See also[edit]

  • Command of the sea
  • Maritime republics
  • Naval power
  • Thalassocracy

Notes[edit]

^ Nation is a member of the Group of Twenty.[26]
^ Nation is a member of the Group of Seven.[27]
^ Nation is a member of BRICS.[28]
